overview_summary: All five neighbors maintain a low public profile with no known stances on development or clean energy projects. None holds an official position in Anderson County or has been visible in community debates, and all are considered low-influence in terms of community impact.

neighbors.name: Edward L. Heath & Lois C. Heath
neighbors.claims: Edward and Lois Heath own a rural parcel in Anderson County ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=Only%20658%20of%20the%20potential,job%20opportunities%20to%20the%20area)). No public records indicate they have taken any stance or held civic roles related to development ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=Only%20658%20of%20the%20potential,job%20opportunities%20to%20the%20area)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight respect for farmland and maintaining property values when approaching the Heaths.

neighbors.name: Carolina Jenkins
neighbors.claims: Carolina Jenkins is a local property owner with no evident public profile ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=keeping%20economic%20growth%20out%20of,businesses%2C%20farms%20and%20property%20values)). Her name does not appear in any reported community meetings or news on development issues ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=keeping%20economic%20growth%20out%20of,businesses%2C%20farms%20and%20property%20values)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Emphasize that the project won’t hurt home values or neighborhood character.

neighbors.name: Meghan E. Mumpower & Erick A. Sanchez Mart
neighbors.claims: Meghan Mumpower has been listed as affiliated with a diet center business in Greenville ([local.yahoo.com](https://local.yahoo.com/info-231832580-mumpower-meghan-elizabeth-greenville#:~:text=1)). Neither she nor co-owner Erick A. Sanchez-Martinez has been noted participating in local land-use debates ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=Only%20658%20of%20the%20potential,job%20opportunities%20to%20the%20area)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Address the project’s impact on property investment and reassure them of value retention.

neighbors.name: Mark Anthony Starrett
neighbors.claims: Mark Starrett is a private landowner in the area with no known civic positions ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=keeping%20economic%20growth%20out%20of,businesses%2C%20farms%20and%20property%20values)). He has not publicly expressed opinions on development or energy projects in Anderson County ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=keeping%20economic%20growth%20out%20of,businesses%2C%20farms%20and%20property%20values)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach as a neighbor concerned with maintaining property values and quality of life.

neighbors.name: Robert Dustin Antici
neighbors.claims: Robert Dustin Antici, 40, lives on Skyland Drive in Belton ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/robert-antici#:~:text=Robert%20Dustin%20Antici%2C%20age%2040)) ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/robert-antici#:~:text=231%20Skyland%20Dr%2C%20Belton%2C%20SC%2C,current%20address)). He owns adjacent parcels at 229 and 231 Skyland Drive ([besthistorysites.net](https://besthistorysites.net/name/robert-antici#:~:text=231%20Skyland%20Dr%2C%20Belton%2C%20SC%2C,current%20address)) and has no documented involvement in local development discussions ([scbiznews.com](https://scbiznews.com/anderson-planned-development-proposals-flounder-with-controversy/#:~:text=keeping%20economic%20growth%20out%20of,businesses%2C%20farms%20and%20property%20values)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reassure him how the project will not negatively affect local property values or daily life.
